channel.title: Basic help
channel.description:
I'm a complete n00b when it comes to actually writing scripts (been heavily using them for over a year, left a few months ago, just in time to miss all the fun) and now I'm trying to write a script, and I can't seem to figure out what I'm missing. Super simple, just trying to get the mouse to track a white ball around the screen (not RS). Once I can get that working, I'll deal with the other problems (more then one ball mostly).
Can anyone point me in the right direction with a bit of code? :)

item.title: Basic help
item.dc:creator: @Neo.Shroom Neo.Shroom
item.description:
@Neo.Shroom wrote:

Well, I took out the wait and fixed the ) myself almost immeadiatly ^^

Still can’t get it working, I guess there’s a white frame around the box, so it starts searching top left corner, finds white, and gets stuck there. I’m off to try and learn DTMs, from what i’ve read (not much) that might work a little better…

Thanks guys!

Read full topic

item.title: Basic help
item.dc:creator: @Thrice Thrice
item.description:
@Thrice wrote:

[code]program New;

var
x,y :integer;

const
ballcol=0; //ball colour

begin
if(FindColor(x,y,ballcol,0,0,550,400))then
repeat
MoveMouse(x,y);
until(false);
end.[/code]

this is my attempt…

Read full topic

item.title: Basic help
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

cept he needs it to follow. Take out the wait and put a repeat… until(IskeyDown’f’)loop. That will continuously follow the ball

Read full topic

item.title: Basic help
item.dc:creator: @KyleGut3 KyleGut3
item.description:
@KyleGut3 wrote:

[code]program New;

var
x,y :integer;

const
ballcol=0; //ball colour

procedure MovetoBall;
begin
if(FindColor(x,y,ballcol,0,0,550,400)then
begin
MoveMouse(x,y);
wait(100);
end;
end;

begin
repeat
MovetoBall();
until(false);
end.[/code]

You need to change the 550,400 to the size of the game screen, and the color in the constant.

that should work.

Read full topic
